definition: to put up/to build (scaffolding)/to hang (clothes on a pole)/to connect/to join/to arrange in pairs/to match/to add/to throw in (resources)/to take (boat, train)/variant of 褡[da1]
official records/grade (of goods)/file/records/shelves/slot/gap/crosspiece/classifier for crosspieces/classifier for events, affairs etc/Taiwan pr. [dang3]

sentences.english: Suarez and Andy Carroll could be a real handful together next season.
sentences.chinese: 小蘇和安迪下賽季的搭檔一定會很牛逼的。

sentences.english: And after you're let in by your father's old partner, what?
sentences.chinese: 你父親的老搭檔讓你參加後又怎樣呢？

sentences.english: I asked to get buddied up with an experienced diver .
sentences.chinese: 我要求和有經驗的潛水員搭檔。
我和我的搭檔很合得來。

sentences.english: Partner, Lake Partners Strategy Consultants, Seattle, Washington.
sentences.chinese: 搭檔，搭檔湖安全策略顧客，西雅圖，華盛頓。

sentences.english: Partner, Lake Partners Strategy Consultants, Seattle, Washington.
sentences.chinese: 搭檔，搭檔湖安全策略顧客，西雅圖，華盛頓。

sentences.english: We were good partners in former days.
sentences.chinese: 怎麼說我們以前也是好搭檔嘛。

sentences.english: There's just three burlap sacks in here. To which his partner replies…
sentences.chinese: 這裏只有三個麻袋，他的一個搭檔說。

sentences.english: Li Ying paired off with Liu Hua in a tennis doubles match.
sentences.chinese: 李英在網球雙打中與劉華搭檔。

sentences.english: When you go into the interview, speak clearly so you can be heard.
sentences.chinese: 口試時要口齒清晰讓考官和搭檔能夠聽清你的話。

sentences.english: Soon, Nacho and his partner are making a lot of money.
sentences.chinese: 奈奇和他的搭檔很快就賺進大把鈔票。

sentences.english: Li Lin and her partner plan to apply for a business license.
sentences.chinese: 林麗和她的搭檔打算申請營業執照。

sentences.english: The dynamic duo to which he refers is the fearsome partnership of Rio Ferdinand and Nemanja Vidic.
sentences.chinese: 這對搭檔就是令人生畏的費迪南德和維迪奇。

sentences.english: Oho, you are a true partner.
My partner surprised me by leading with a spade.
sentences.chinese: 我的搭檔先出黑桃，使我感到喫驚。

sentences.english: "Janice, " Minmei said, approaching her former partner.
sentences.chinese: “賈妮斯，”明美朝着她之前的搭檔走過去。

definition: cast and crew/performers and production team
to rely on/to depend on/by means of/thanks to/sth that one relies on/also written 憑借|凭借[ping2 jie4]
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
to praise without cease (idiom); praise sb to high heaven
Chow Yun-Fat (1955-), Hong Kong TV and film star
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
to put on a play/to perform/fig. to pretend/to feign
Andy Lau (1961-), Hong Kong Cantopop singer and actor
